column4: does anyone know of an administrative tool to completely lock down the UI for a machine while it is in maintenance mode?
what do you mean lock it down in maintenance mode ?
check the uuid's in grub's menu.lst and fstab again
I changed all the UUIDs to /dev/sda2
thats all that could be effecting it, please pastebin your menu.lst, your fstab and the output of "sudo blikd"
I don't see a tool called blikd in repos or on my system
you open the terminal and type "sudo blikd"
yes, and it says not found
please also put the output of "sudo blkid"
try setting the UUID's instead of the device names, I agree it shouldn't matter but lets check it
nope, I changed my uuids in fstab and menu.lst and it is still using sda1 as /
I can't see how it can be mounting the wrong file system ?
I don't either.  this is pretty weird
